modules.comments:
This is the main entry point for Gesso applications and contains functions
for running `Aff` values. For a full-page application where Gesso is the
root component, typical usage of this module would be:
```purescript
main :: Effect Unit
main = Gesso.launch appSpec
```
Or to confine Gesso to an element on the page, use `launchIn` with a query
selector:
```purescript
main :: Effect Unit
main = Gesso.launchIn "#some-element-id" appSpec
```
If it's necessary to perform other `Aff` actions, the `run` function is
available:
```purescript
runGessoAff do
  body <- awaitBody
  Gesso.run appSpec body
```
When Gesso is a subcomponent of another Halogen component, run Halogen and
include Gesso as a child component in the standard way.

declarations.comments: Launch a Gesso application in the page body.
declarations.title: launch

declarations.comments:
Launch a Gesso application in a given element. The String argument should
be a valid query selector for some element on the page.
declarations.title: launchIn

declarations.comments:
An `Aff` which starts a Gesso application in the provided element. Used
when performing other `Aff` effects at the same time as running the
application.
declarations.title: run

declarations.comments:
Run an `Aff` value such as the one produced by `run`. Alias for
`Halogen.Aff.runHalogenAff`.
declarations.title: runGessoAff

modules.name: Gesso

declarations.comments: Tries to find an element in the document.
declarations.title: selectElement

declarations.comments: Waits for the document to load.
declarations.title: awaitLoad

declarations.comments: Waits for the document to load and then finds the `body` element.
declarations.title: awaitBody

modules.comments: Functions and configuration necessary to start a Gesso application.

declarations.comments:
`AppBehavior` holds the functions that make an application run.

- `render` draws on the component every animation frame.
- `update` runs on each animation frame, just before `render`.
- `fixed` runs at a set interval of time.
- `interactions` are events which will be attached to the canvas element.
- `output` defines how (or if) the component should send information out to
  a parent component.
- `input` defines how the component's state should change in response to
  receiving input from a parent component.
declarations.title: AppBehavior

declarations.comments:
`AppSpec` holds information about the setup and behavior of a Gesso
component.

- `name` is the name of the application, which doubles as the HTML `id` for
  the canvas element.
- `initialState` is the initial state for the application.
- `viewBox` is the desired dimensions for the drawing area.
- `window` defines how the screen element should size and position itself.
- `behavior` contains functions that control i/o, updates, and rendering.
declarations.title: AppSpec

declarations.comments:
There are three modes that determine the size and position of a Gesso
component:

- `Fixed` creates a screen of the specified size.
- `Stretch` expands to fill its containing element.
- `FullScreen` takes up the entire page from the top left corner to the
  bottom right.
declarations.title: WindowMode

declarations.comments:
A default `AppBehavior` which can be modified piecemeal like Halogen's
`EvalSpec`. It does nothing on its own.
declarations.title: defaultBehavior

modules.name: Gesso.Application

declarations.comments:
An function that may update the application state. It runs on every frame,
before the render function. It knows the following:

- `Delta` is a record containing current and previous timestamps and the
  time elapsed since the previous frame.
- `Scalers` is a record containing scaling information for transforming
  coordinates between the drawing and the canvas.
- `state` is the state of the application

The update function may return a new state if changes are necessary (or
`Nothing` if not).

This type is also used by Interaction handlers and when receiving input
from a host application.
declarations.title: UpdateFunction

declarations.comments: A partially applied `UpdateFunction` that already has the `Delta` record.
declarations.title: TimestampedUpdate

declarations.comments:
A function that draws on the component. It knows the following:

- `Context2D` is the drawing context of the canvas element
- `Delta` is a record containing current and previous timestamps and the
  time elapsed since the previous frame.
- `Scalers` is a record containing scaling information for transforming
  coordinates between the drawing and the canvas.
- `state` is the state of the application, with `States` containing the two
  most recent states and the time progress between them (on the interval
  `[0, 1]`).

The render function may run any operations in `Effect`, not just functions
related to drawing on the canvas.
declarations.title: RenderFunction

declarations.comments:
When the state of an application changes, an output producer compares the
old and new states and may send output to the component's parent based on
the difference.
declarations.title: OutputProducer

declarations.comments:
An input receiver is a variant of an update function that can receive
information from the component's parent and produce an update function
in response.
declarations.title: InputReceiver

declarations.comments:
An update function that occurs at a fixed, regular interval, rather than on
every animation frame.
declarations.title: FixedUpdate

declarations.comments:
An update function that occurs at a fixed, regular interval, rather than on
every animation frame.
declarations.title: FixedUpdate

declarations.comments:
An input receiver is a variant of an update function that can receive
information from the component's parent and produce an update function
in response.
declarations.title: InputReceiver

declarations.comments:
When the state of an application changes, an output producer compares the
old and new states and may send output to the component's parent based on
the difference.
declarations.title: OutputProducer

declarations.comments:
A function that draws on the component. It knows the following:

- `Context2D` is the drawing context of the canvas element
- `Delta` is a record containing current and previous timestamps and the
  time elapsed since the previous frame.
- `Scalers` is a record containing scaling information for transforming
  coordinates between the drawing and the canvas.
- `state` is the state of the application, with `States` containing the two
  most recent states and the time progress between them (on the interval
  `[0, 1]`).

The render function may run any operations in `Effect`, not just functions
related to drawing on the canvas.
declarations.title: RenderFunction

declarations.comments: A partially applied `UpdateFunction` that already has the `Delta` record.
declarations.title: TimestampedUpdate

declarations.comments:
An function that may update the application state. It runs on every frame,
before the render function. It knows the following:

- `Delta` is a record containing current and previous timestamps and the
  time elapsed since the previous frame.
- `Scalers` is a record containing scaling information for transforming
  coordinates between the drawing and the canvas.
- `state` is the state of the application

The update function may return a new state if changes are necessary (or
`Nothing` if not).

This type is also used by Interaction handlers and when receiving input
from a host application.
declarations.title: UpdateFunction

modules.comments:
Gesso Canvas is a Halogen component that handles creating a canvas element,
calling `requestAnimationFrame`, attaching events, and running render and
update functions.

declarations.comments:
Used to wrap Queries from a parent Halogen component. The component's input
type is defined by the `InputReceiver` in the
[`Gesso.Application.AppSpec`](Gesso.Application.html#t:AppSpec).
declarations.title: CanvasInput

declarations.comments:
Used to wrap Output to a parent Halogen component. The component's output
type is defined by the `OutputProducer` in the
[`Gesso.Application.AppSpec`](Gesso.Application.html#t:AppSpec).
declarations.title: CanvasOutput

declarations.comments:
A Halogen slot type for the Canvas component, which is used to include it
inside another Halogen component.
declarations.title: Slot

declarations.comments: A proxy type for Canvas for use with `Slot`.
declarations.title: _gessoCanvas

declarations.comments:
Definition of the Canvas component. Can be used to slot the canvas into a
parent Halogen component.
declarations.title: component

modules.name: Gesso.Canvas

modules.comments:
Internal helper functions that the Canvas component uses to style and
position itself and access the canvas's drawing context.

declarations.comments:
Wrapper for a `Web.DOM.Element.Element` to tag elements that came from this
module.
declarations.title: Canvas

declarations.comments:
Wrapper for `getElementById` which returns a `Canvas`.

`getElementById` from `Web.DOM.NonElementParentNode`, which returns a
`Web.DOM.Element.Element`, is different from `getCanvasElementById` from
`Graphics.Canvas`, which returns a `Graphics.Canvas.CanvasElement`, so
they're unfortunately incompatible.
declarations.title: getCanvasByAppName

declarations.comments:
Get the bounding client rect for a `Canvas` element and convert it to a
`ClientRect` value.
declarations.title: getCanvasClientRect

declarations.comments: Attempt to get the `Context2D` for this component's `canvas` element.
declarations.title: getContextByAppName

declarations.comments: Get size and positioning CSS based on the app's window mode.
declarations.title: style

declarations.comments: Convert a `width` and `height` to HTML properties.
declarations.title: toSizeProps

modules.name: Gesso.Canvas.Element

declarations.comments:
Extract `x` and `y` coordinates from a `MouseEvent` using the
[`pageX` and `pageY` properties](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent/pageX)
declarations.title: fromMouseEvent

declarations.comments: A row representing anything that can have a `width` and `height`.
declarations.title: Size

declarations.comments:
A row representing anything that can have `x`, `y`, `width`, and `height`
properties.
declarations.title: Rectangular

declarations.comments: A rectangle positioned in space.
declarations.title: Rect

declarations.comments: A row representing anything that can have `x` and `y` values.
declarations.title: Position

declarations.comments: An `(x, y)` coordinate
declarations.title: Point

declarations.comments: The size of a rectangle.
declarations.title: Area

declarations.comments: An `Area` with no width or height
declarations.title: sizeless

declarations.comments: A `Rect` with no width or height, located at the origin.
declarations.title: null

declarations.comments:
Data and functions for converting between the coordinate systems of the
canvas element on the page and the view box of the application/drawing.

`scale` is the amount that the view box has been scaled up or down to fit
within the canvas element.

`canvas` and `drawing` contain the dimensions of the named space and
functions for converting coordinates to itself.
declarations.title: Scalers

declarations.comments:
Data and functions for working with a coordinate system:

The `x`, `y`, `width`, and `height` fields are the origin and size of the
system. The `rect` field contains all of them as well - sometimes it's
easier to access them indiviually, and sometimes it's easier to access them
as a complete `Rect`.

`scaling` contains functions to scale `x`, `y`, `length`, and entire
records, but they're more convenient to use with the `to` and `from`
functions rather than being called directly:

```purescript
-- this:
{ x: 1.0, y: 2.0 } `to` canvas

-- not:
canvas.scaling.all { x: 1.0, y: 2.0 }
```
declarations.title: Scaler

declarations.comments:
Convert a single `y` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
y' = y `yTo` canvas
```
declarations.title: yTo

declarations.comments:
[`yTo`](#v:yTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
y' = canvas `yFrom` y
```
declarations.title: yFrom

declarations.comments:
Convert a single `x` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
x' = x `xTo` canvas
```
declarations.title: xTo

declarations.comments:
[`xTo`](#v:xTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
x' = canvas `xFrom` x
```
declarations.title: xFrom

declarations.comments:
Convert fields in an arbitrary record to the coordinate system of a
`Scaler`. If any of these fields is found and has type `Number`, it will be
converted:

- `x` fields: `x`, `x1`, `x2`
- `y` fields: `y`, `y1`, `y2`
- `length` fields: `width`, `w`, `height`, `h`, `radius`, `r`, `length`,
  `len`, `l`

```purescript
line' = { x1: 0.0, y1: 0.0, x2: 1.0, y2: 1.0 } `to` canvas
circle' = { x: 0.0, y: 0.0, r: 1.0 } `to` canvas
```
declarations.title: to

declarations.comments:
Convert a single `length` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
l' = l `lengthTo` canvas
```
declarations.title: lengthTo

declarations.comments:
[`lengthTo`](#v:lengthTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
l' = canvas `lengthFrom` l
```
declarations.title: lengthFrom
from

declarations.comments:
Convert a single `y` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
y' = y |~> canvas
```

[`yTo`](#v:yTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
y' = canvas <~| y
```

[`lengthTo`](#v:lengthTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
l' = canvas <~/ l
```

[`xTo`](#v:xTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
x' = canvas <~- x
```

Convert a single `length` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
l' = l /~> canvas
```

Convert a single `x` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
x' = x -~> canvas
```

Convert an arbitrary record to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
line' = { x1: 0.0, y1: 0.0, x2: 1.0, y2: 1.0 } *~> canvas
circle' = { x: 0.0, y: 0.0, r: 1.0 } *~> canvas
```

modules.comments: A collection of types and functions for specifying sizes and positions.

declarations.comments: The size of a rectangle.
declarations.title: Area

declarations.comments: An `(x, y)` coordinate
declarations.title: Point

declarations.comments: A row representing anything that can have `x` and `y` values.
declarations.title: Position

declarations.comments: A rectangle positioned in space.
declarations.title: Rect

declarations.comments:
A row representing anything that can have `x`, `y`, `width`, and `height`
properties.
declarations.title: Rectangular

declarations.comments: A row representing anything that can have a `width` and `height`.
declarations.title: Size

declarations.comments:
Given the sizes of an inner and an outer rectangle, find the largest size
the inner can be scaled to while still fitting entirely within the outer.
declarations.title: largestContainedArea

declarations.comments: A `Rect` with no width or height, located at the origin.
declarations.title: null

declarations.comments: An `Area` with no width or height
declarations.title: sizeless

modules.name: Gesso.Geometry.Dimensions

declarations.comments:
Data and functions for converting between the coordinate systems of the
canvas element on the page and the view box of the application/drawing.

`scale` is the amount that the view box has been scaled up or down to fit
within the canvas element.

`canvas` and `drawing` contain the dimensions of the named space and
functions for converting coordinates to itself.
declarations.title: Scalers

declarations.comments:
Create a `Scalers` record based on the view box of the application and the
client rect ([`Gesso.Canvas.Element.getCanvasClientRect`](Gesso.Canvas.Element.html#v:getCanvasClientRect),
[MDN: DOMRect](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DOMRect))
of the canvas.
declarations.title: mkScalers

declarations.comments:
Convert an arbitrary record to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
line' = { x1: 0.0, y1: 0.0, x2: 1.0, y2: 1.0 } *~> canvas
circle' = { x: 0.0, y: 0.0, r: 1.0 } *~> canvas
```

Convert a single `x` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
x' = x -~> canvas
```

Convert a single `length` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
l' = l /~> canvas
```

[`xTo`](#v:xTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
x' = canvas <~- x
```

[`lengthTo`](#v:lengthTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
l' = canvas <~/ l
```

[`yTo`](#v:yTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
y' = canvas <~| y
```

Convert a single `y` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
y' = y |~> canvas
```

Data and functions for working with a coordinate system:

The `x`, `y`, `width`, and `height` fields are the origin and size of the
system. The `rect` field contains all of them as well - sometimes it's
easier to access them indiviually, and sometimes it's easier to access them
as a complete `Rect`.

`scaling` contains functions to scale `x`, `y`, `length`, and entire
records, but they're more convenient to use with the `to` and `from`
functions rather than being called directly:

```purescript
-- this:
{ x: 1.0, y: 2.0 } `to` canvas

-- not:
canvas.scaling.all { x: 1.0, y: 2.0 }
```
declarations.title: Scaler

declarations.comments:
`x`, `y`, and `length` `Number -> Number` functions for converting between
coordinate systems.
declarations.title: ScalingFunctions

declarations.comments:
Typeclass for an arbitrary record. `scale` walks through the fields of a
record, and if any value `:: a`, checks if the map has a function with the
same key. If so, applies the function to the value.
declarations.title: Scalable
from

declarations.comments:
[`lengthTo`](#v:lengthTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
l' = canvas `lengthFrom` l
```
declarations.title: lengthFrom

declarations.comments:
Convert a single `length` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
l' = l `lengthTo` canvas
```
declarations.title: lengthTo

declarations.comments:
Create a `Scaler` record for a coordinate system using its dimensions and
`x`, `y`, and `length` scaling functions.
declarations.title: mkScaler

declarations.comments:
Convert fields in an arbitrary record to the coordinate system of a
`Scaler`. If any of these fields is found and has type `Number`, it will be
converted:

- `x` fields: `x`, `x1`, `x2`
- `y` fields: `y`, `y1`, `y2`
- `length` fields: `width`, `w`, `height`, `h`, `radius`, `r`, `length`,
  `len`, `l`

```purescript
line' = { x1: 0.0, y1: 0.0, x2: 1.0, y2: 1.0 } `to` canvas
circle' = { x: 0.0, y: 0.0, r: 1.0 } `to` canvas
```
declarations.title: to

declarations.comments:
[`xTo`](#v:xTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
x' = canvas `xFrom` x
```
declarations.title: xFrom

declarations.comments:
Convert a single `x` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
x' = x `xTo` canvas
```
declarations.title: xTo

declarations.comments:
[`yTo`](#v:yTo) with arguments flipped:
```purescript
y' = canvas `yFrom` y
```
declarations.title: yFrom

declarations.comments:
Convert a single `y` value to the coordinate system of a `Scaler`:
```purescript
y' = y `yTo` canvas
```
declarations.title: yTo

modules.comments:
Interactions are a wrapper for HTML events that allow specifying event
types and handlers which are attached to the canvas when it's created.
Interactions are part of the `AppSpec` and will typically be specified as
an update of the [`default`](#v:default) record, similar to `mkEval` and
`defaultEval` in Halogen.

The [`Interactions`](#t:Interactions) type is a record of arrays of
interactions for each event type.

declarations.comments:
A default `Interactions` record containing no interactions. The attributes
can be overridden individually instead of manually creating a complete but
mostly empty record. For example,
```
Interactions.default { keyboard = [ handleKeyDown ] }
```
declarations.title: default

modules.name: Gesso.Interactions

declarations.comments:
`Interactions` is a record containing arrays of interactions for each type
of event that Canvas supports. It's used in
[`Gesso.Application.AppBehavior`](Gesso.Application.html#t:AppBehavior)
to add event handlers to a component.
declarations.title: Interactions

declarations.comments:
An Interaction is a combination event listener and handler which is turned
into an HTML property and attached to a Gesso canvas. They can be
constructed with the "`on`" functions (`onMouseMove`, `onKeyDown`, etc.)
declarations.title: Interaction

declarations.comments:
An event handler is a variant of an update function, which receives an
event and produces an update function in response.
declarations.title: Handler

declarations.comments: Basic type for all DOM events.
declarations.title: Event

modules.comments:
This module contains constructors for Interactions for event properties
that Canvas supports. The list of properties comes from
[`DOM.HTML.Indexed.HTMLcanvas`](https://pursuit.purescript.org/packages/purescript-dom-indexed/7.0.0/docs/DOM.HTML.Indexed#t:HTMLcanvas).
A number of those event properties are not currently exported by
`Halogen.HTML.Events`. For completeness, they are included here but
commented out.
modules.name: Gesso.Interactions.Events

modules.comments:
Definitions of the Interaction type as well as event handlers and event
listener HTML properties.

declarations.comments:
An `IProp` is an HTML property, with kind
`IProp :: Row Type -> Type -> Type`, where the row type is the set of all
valid properties for the element that this property will be attached to.

Typically, an event listener type would look like this:
```
onMouseMove
  :: forall r i
   . (MouseEvent -> i)
  -> IProp (onMouseMove :: MouseEvent | r) i
```
where the event type is predetermined and the row type is parameterized to
allow any element with an `onMouseMove` property.

This generic `EventProp` is the inverse: parameterized to allow any event
type, but the property must be a valid property of the `HTMLcanvas` row.
declarations.title: EventProp

declarations.comments:
An event handler is a variant of an update function, which receives an
event and produces an update function in response.
declarations.title: Handler

declarations.comments:
An Interaction is a combination event listener and handler which is turned
into an HTML property and attached to a Gesso canvas. They can be
constructed with the "`on`" functions (`onMouseMove`, `onKeyDown`, etc.)
declarations.title: Interaction

declarations.comments:
`Interactions` is a record containing arrays of interactions for each type
of event that Canvas supports. It's used in
[`Gesso.Application.AppBehavior`](Gesso.Application.html#t:AppBehavior)
to add event handlers to a component.
declarations.title: Interactions

declarations.comments:
Convert an `Interactions` record to an array of HTML properties. The return
value of the `toCallback` parameter, `i`, is only known by the component
and should be whatever `Action` type the component has, like `QueueUpdate`
in Canvas.
declarations.title: toProps

modules.name: Gesso.Interactions.Internal

declarations.comments: Basic type for all DOM events.
declarations.title: Event

modules.comments:
Types used when dealing with multiple versions of the same thing - most
often, the application state.

declarations.comments:
Two different versions of the same thing. Used when the old and new
versions are probably not immediately sequential - there may have been many
versions between `old` and `new`.
declarations.title: Compare

declarations.comments:
A record for keeping track of changes to a value which may change many
times, when it is important to track the original, current, and previous
values, and comparing the values directly is impossible. Useful as an
accumulator when folding.
declarations.title: History

declarations.comments:
Two different, sequential versions of the same thing, and the amount of
progress from the earlier to the later. `t` should be in the interval
`[0, 1]`.
declarations.title: States

declarations.comments: Calculate the linear interpolation between two values
declarations.title: lerp

modules.name: Gesso.State

declarations.comments:
A current time, a previous time, and the difference between them. All
values are in milliseconds.

For per-frame updates and the rendering function, `last` is the time of the
previous animation frame and `now` is the time of the current animation
frame.

For fixed-rate updates, `last` is the scheduled time of the previous
fixed-rate update and `now` is the update's scheduled time.

For interaction events and Halogen queries, `last` is the time of the
previous animation frame and `now` is the event's arrival time.
declarations.title: Delta

declarations.comments:
A interval of time, in milliseconds, to space out repeating an action, or
`Never` perform the action. Constructed with [`hz`](#v:hz) or
[`never`](#v:never).
declarations.title: Interval

declarations.comments: A time in the past, in milliseconds.
declarations.title: Last

declarations.comments:
The current time in milliseconds, or the time at which a value became
`Stamped`.
declarations.title: Now

declarations.comments:
A `RequestAnimationFrameId` is returned when calling
`requestAnimationFrame`. This can be used to cancel the request.
declarations.title: RequestAnimationFrameId

declarations.comments:
An item and a specific time associated with that item. Used for comparing
timestamped values produced by [`stamp`](#v:stamp) and
[`stampInterval`](#v:stampInterval).
declarations.title: Stamped

declarations.comments:
Results of repeatedly timestamping a function at certain interval:

* `last`: the timestamp of the latest item in the list
* `items`: a list of repeated applications of `Delta`s to the function,
  with timestamps
declarations.title: StampedBatch

declarations.comments:
Cancel a request for an animation frame using the `RequestAnimationFrameId`
returned by `requestAnimationFrame`.
declarations.title: cancelAnimationFrame

declarations.comments: Create a Delta from a current time and a previous time.
declarations.title: delta

declarations.comments: Convert a current time into a previous time.
declarations.title: elapse

declarations.comments:
Construct an `Interval` from Hz or frames per second. Invalid frequencies
(`±Infinity`, `NaN`, zero, or negative) result in a `Never` interval.
declarations.title: hz

declarations.comments: An interval that never occurs.
declarations.title: never

declarations.comments:
An interface to `window.requestAnimationFrame` which passes the timestamp
argument to the callback function.

Provided because `requestAnimationFrame` in `Web.HTML.Window` only accepts
an `Effect Unit` instead of a `Number -> Effect Unit`.
declarations.title: requestAnimationFrame

declarations.comments: Sort a list of `Stamped` records ascending chronologically.
declarations.title: sort

declarations.comments:
For a `last` timestamp and a function `f :: Delta -> a` (such as
[`Gesso.Application.Behavior.UpdateFunction`](Gesso.Application.Behavior.html#t:UpdateFunction), create a
`Delta` between `last` and the current time, apply the delta to `f`, and
return a record containing the current time and the result of `f delta`.
declarations.title: stamp

declarations.comments:
Repeatedly timestamp a function at a given interval, starting at the `last`
time plus the interval, as long as the timestamp does not pass the current
time.

The `last` value in the returned record should be saved by the caller to
pass in as the `last` argument for the next call to `stampInterval`.
declarations.title: stampInterval

declarations.comments: Get a single `Last` value at the current time, useful for starting a timer.
declarations.title: started

declarations.comments:
Convert the span between two periods of time to a unitless number of
intervals, typically between `0.0` and `1.0`. The result is used with
linear interpolation to find a weighted average between two values.

For a `Never` interval, returns `1`, signalling to use the newer value and
ignore the older.
declarations.title: toRatio

packageMeta.description: Easily build <canvas> applications in PureScript — Compatible with Halogen
packageMeta.name: purescript-gesso
